Patrons & Advocates

Our patrons & advocates play an important role within our charity. Not only do they support the work we do, they help raise awareness of Skyzdalimit and direct people to us in times of need.

Kerri Quinn

Kerri Quinn is an actress/singer from Belfast. She stars as Vicki Jefferies in Coronation Street. In 2006 she starred as Brenna alongside Christopher Eccelestonein the powerful TV drama, Come Home. She also starred in Season 2 of Derry Girls. She performs regularly on stage at the Lyric Theatre and the MAC.

Kerri became Patron for Skyzdalimit in 2018 after she was “blown away” by the Skyzdalimit performance of Prince of Africa, based on The Lion King.

Kerri has a daughter, Libby, and currently lives in Belfast. Kerri is to appear in a cameo role in the upcoming Skyzdalimit performance of Circus, inspired by The Greatest Show.

Ryan Tracey

Dad-of-seven Ryan “Duff Balloons” Tracey, hails from Omagh and is the current Guinness Book of Records world record holder for the fastest time to model five balloon sculptures whilst blindfolded, with the help of his young son Matthew (7) Ryan, aka Duff The Balloon Ninja.

Ryan became a household name after he wowed the judges with his amazing balloon tricks on Britain’s Got Talent in 2017 and again in 2021.

Ryan was inducted as Skyzdalimit Advocate in 2019.

Ryan is also to appear in a cameo role in the upcoming Skyzdalimit performance of Circus, inspired by The Greatest Show.
